extendedIngredients.name: fresh mint leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 handfuls mint leaves, chopped, plus extra for serving

recipes.title: Minty aubergine & goat's cheese
recipes.instructions: Make the chermoula by mixing all ingredientstogether in a small bowl, setting 2 tbsp of it asideif you intend to make the carrot salad, right.When the coals are hot, grill the aubergineslices for about 5 mins on each side until floppyand heavily marked from the grill.Drizzle a little chermoula over the base of amedium flameproof roasting tin. Cover thebottom of the tray with a layer of aubergine, thentop the aubergines with a scattering of tomatoes,goat’s cheese, some seasoning and a drizzle ofchermoula. Repeat layers. Top everything with afinal layer of aubergine and drizzle of chermoula.Cover the pan with tin foil and place on thebarbecue. If the barbecue has a lid, use it. Leavefor 20 mins until sizzling. To serve, lift off the foil,scatter with fresh mint and cut into wedges.

steps.step: Make the chermoula by mixing all ingredientstogether in a small bowl, setting 2 tbsp of it asideif you intend to make the carrot salad, right.When the coals are hot, grill the aubergineslices for about 5 mins on each side until floppyand heavily marked from the grill.

Drizzle a little chermoula over the base of amedium flameproof roasting tin. Cover thebottom of the tray with a layer of aubergine, thentop the aubergines with a scattering of tomatoes,goat’s cheese, some seasoning and a drizzle ofchermoula. Repeat layers. Top everything with afinal layer of aubergine and drizzle of chermoula.Cover the pan with tin foil and place on thebarbecue. If the barbecue has a lid, use it. Leavefor 20 mins until sizzling. To serve, lift off the foil,scatter with fresh mint and cut into wedges.
